intro: Ctenium floridanum, commonly known as Florida ctenium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of water bodies, preferring moist to aquatic habitats. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a mild aromatic scent. Ctenium floridanum plays a role in supporting local biodiversity by providing habitat and nectar for various insects.
